lines.text: [last lines]
"Conscience makes cowards of us all".

[offscreen]
Ah, shut up!
[hits the narrator in the head, forming a lump which remains in the silhouette as he walks away]
Good evening.
Well, you got away from the law, didn't you?
[Sylvester nods]
I bet you wish you could get away from your conscience that easily.
Ah, conscience, shmonshience! That bird doesn't even enter my mind.
[turns on the radio]
And now your local company will present gas chamber music for - I, I, I, I mean your local gas company will present chamber music for your enjoyment.
[Sylvester perks up and switches off the radio]
Are you nervous, pussycat?
Yep.
Why don't you try reading? That always helps.
Yeah. Yeah, that's a good idea, and besides, reading is good for you.
[picks a book from the shelf, sits down and reads it]
Once upon a time there lived three birds - a mama bird, a papa bird, and a cute little... blue eyed... baby bird.
[drops the book and screams]
[first lines]
Tonight, ladies and gentlemen, we bring you a story about murder.

[to Sylvester]
Well, you did it, didn't you, cat?

[panting]
Yeah, yeah...
You got rid of that helpless little blue-eyed menace to society, didn't you?

[chuckling]
Yeah. Yeah.
Sardines and milk wouldn't have done it. You had to commit murder.

[shocked]
*Murder*?
[laughing]
That's silly! Ridiculous! Murder...
Of course, there's a good chance they'll never find out who committed this horrible crime.
[Sylvester notices newspapers headlining the police hunt for a criminal called "The Cat"]
